result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marvin P. Lynch

records.addlTxt:
1:54 PM Attorney Drew Lehman in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Marvin P. Lynch not in court.  Attorney Xavier Solis in court for Marvin P. Lynch. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Victim rights compliance. DE was unable to appear as this hearing was originally scheduled for tomorrow at 1:30 pm. Attorney Solis advises the Court that the matter is not resolved. Both parties are ready to proceed to trial. The State requests relief from the briefing schedule/scheduling order in regards to the witness list. Court will grant the State's request, but will allow Attorney Solis to raise issue with any surprise witnesses added to the State's witness list. Ludwig hearing to be held on Monday morning.

Attorney Drew Lehman in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Marvin P. Lynch in court. Attorney Xavier Solis not in court. Clerk N. Nobile.
NO RECORD: DE has been here since 10:30 am and it is now 11 am. Clerk emails and calls Attorney Solis; no answer and voicemail box was full. Court will adjourn hearing. Attorney Solis to be notified of new date by email.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

09:15 AM  State appeared by Attorney Drew Lehman. Defendant, Marvin P. Lynch, appeared with Attorney Aileen Henry who appears on behalf of Attorney Xavier Solis.   Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES:   Victim rights compliance. Attorney Henry states that the matter is not resolved and is requesting one more FPT be scheduled. The State takes no position. The Court will scheduled the matter for FPT and for trial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 10:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury selection scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Drew Lehman appeared for the Prosecution. Defendant, Marvin P. Lynch, appeared with Attorney Xavier Solis. Clerk: S.Shaw.
MINUTES: Atty Solis was recently appointed to the case. Deft requests a brief adjournment. Adjournment request granted. Matter set over.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Minutes:  Judge Dreyfus acting for Branch 3.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Drew Lehman appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person pro se.  Deft does not qualify for SPD; requests advocate counsel.  Court will appoint advocate counsel.  Deft to pay advocate counsel fees at the rate of $75/mo commencing 8/1/22.  Status set for 7/7/22 @ 8:45am.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.  kmk

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
Continued Posted
  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with:  Shantis A(may have 3rd party contact for pick up/drop off of children), Anne H, Casa Del Mare 3508 7th Avenue

222PM   Attorney Emily Gaertner appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  The Court finds probable cause in this case today.  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Plea of Not Guilty entered by the court. Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 8, 2022 at 01:15 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Jury selection scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 09:00 am. $800  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  sg
and witness list filed by the State
